item.title: Chaos with a pocket calculator.
item.description: 1 The logistic map 2 Summarising complexity 3 Building non-linear intuitions 4 Studying non-elephant animals div#TOC li { list-style:none; background-image:none; background-repeat:none; background-position:0; } Most non-fiction books teach you what to think. They give you a new set of facts to trot out when someone brings up pop psychology at the pub or let you feel smug when you ‘explain’ why the Bank of England cut interest rates, in both cases understanding about as much as a parrot does about a cracker.
